channel.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
channel.description:
OK, heres the thing, I have 15 old iMacs (G3, the CRT kind), and I was thinking, how could I take an image from a camcorder, and split it into a 3x5 image, so that each iMac shows a portion of whats being recorded in the camcorder. The iMacs are arranged as show below.
[iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac] [iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac] [iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac][iMac]
So, essentialy, it's a 3x5 array of these: [img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c0/IMac_Bondi_Blue.jpg[/img]
So any ideas on how I could do it?
Thanks, Ilya <3

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Lel RsN’ idea is alot simpler than mine. I’d go with his.

Read full topic

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:13, topic:161497”][quote author=RsN link=topic=219790.msg1918858#msg1918858 date=1197095567]
well… on top of my head I beleive you could connect them all to a local network and then use VLC to transmit/receive a video image, then resize it to fit each portion.
[/quote]
That’s exactly what my initial idea was, I thought you MITB would have some others. Thanks <3[/quote]

wtf he just like totally stole my idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You could probably format the drives and make some sort of OS for it. Like Linux based or something, that sequences all of the PC’s over a Lan connection. just connect 'em all to a router, and connect the router to a main PC like r4ndom said, and have that PC intercept the Camcorder, and send that to the other macs, or maybe just write some sort of software that understands the signals.

Edit: Actually, it could probably be much simpler than making a Linux based operating system. Infact, you could probably just download some kind of program to connect all the Mac’s together. Maybe even some kind of PPoe connection or something. I would google it.

Read full topic
item.source: Dont quite know how to explain it

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

Well seen as though they’re computers you could probably have like 1 master pc that takes input from the camcorder then if you look around you can probably make or find a program to split it appropriately then set up like a LAN with them all and just stream it to the others 100mbs will be fast enough won’t it?

Read full topic

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

The only way I can think you can do it is if you get a box to do 2 things, a) take input, b) split the input up. Still, even if you get one, I doubt you’ll find one for 15 monitors. It’s possible though.

Read full topic
item.source: Dont quite know how to explain it

item.title: Dont quite know how to explain it
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

That’s a nice amount. What’s the Specs on 'em? Would you be willing to spare one? Or possibly sell one?

It’s possible. Though you’ll need maybe a 500 dollar budget to do so. You need to go to BrookStone, and order this stand, it sits on a monitor, and allows other things to sit atop it. Or you’ll need to build a station for it. Possibly out of 4 small cabinets. Other than that it’s wiring it up for multiple monitors. You’ll need to get a special sort of Foxtail to do it. But it’s possible

Read full topic
